name: Audi
description: German Engineer August Horch founded the company August Horch & Cie.Due to misunderstandings among partners.

name: Cadillac
description: Cadillac was named after the great French explorer Antoine Laumet de La Mothe, Sieur de Cadillac, who founded Detroit, Michigan in 1701.

name: BMW
description: The acronym BMW stands for Bayerische Motoren Werke GmnH. The name harks back to the company's origin in the German state of Bavaria.

name: Datsun
description: The company began in 1911 as Kwaishinsha Jidosha Kojo, founded by M. Hashimoto. His dream was to produce cars uniquely suited to Japan.

name: Ferrari
description: The luxury car brand Ferrari is named after its Italian founder who was an official Alto race driver. In 1939, he quit racing to build his own company.

name: Ford
description: Henry Ford founded the Ford Motors Company in 1903.Ford has left his first company Cadillac, and started his own car company.

name: Honda
description: Honda sold what was left of the company to Toyota and used the money to launch the Honda Technical Research Institute.

name: Porsche
description: Porsche is named after its founder, Ferdinand Porsche, who started the company in 1931 Germany.Porsche is the majority shareholder in the Volkswagen family.

name: Mercedes
description: Mercedes-Benz traces its origins to Karl Benz, who created the first internal combustion engine used in a car, the Benz Patent Motorwagen,

name: Aston Martin
description: The name Aston Martin is derived partly from the name of its founder, Lionel Martin, and partly for a stretch of road in Hertfordshire, England, used for racing, called the Aston Hillclimb.
